intro: Ardisia nagaensis, commonly known as the Naga ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of the northern part of the country. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along forest edges. Ardisia nagaensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for certain wildlife species.
